title.narrative: Moving Urban Poor Communities in Mindanao towards Resilience (Move up 4)

description.narrative: The purpose of this action is to build resilience among the urban poor communities in Mindanao by adopting, consolidating and disseminating the urban resilience models developed under different projects such as ECHO (MOVE UP 1-3). Interventions are designed to support five strategically selected cities where conflict and natural disasters cause urban displacement either within the cities, or cities receiving or sending internally displacement people (IDPs) between the cities/municipalities. These were selected based on historic and recent conflict and displacements related trend and IDP's mobility. The action will also target three provinces where the cities are located and/or considered as component city of the province. In addition, another province that also supports IDPs is targeted by the action. Inclusion of provincial level activities under this action aims to align and seek synergy with provincial level long term development, DRR and preparedness plans. Along with promotion of the models that have already been developed, this action will also focus on strengthening social safety net measures to provide more adaptive, shock and crisis responsive services that meet the needs of different vulnerable groups in terms of conflict, natural disasters and displacements at the city and provincial level. At the city and province level, the action will support the review of development, DRR and social safety net /social protection programs/plans, processes as well as criteria for targeting the most vulnerable. The outcomes will be used to lobby and advocate for strengthening services offered by the cities and provinces. At the end of the action, lessons learned from this action, along with previous gains from ECHO funded models, will be documented and disseminated among the stakeholders at the country level and shared at regional level events.
